intro: Eriospermum fragile, commonly known as the slender eriosperm, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in summer. It is adapted to sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its delicate structure and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
